status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
Cannot build or debug even after uninstalling and reinstalling studio. Also reinstalled python and checked file attributes:

error: 

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/Administrator/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/1.7.0/iphone/builder.py", line 1397, in <module>
    main(sys.argv)
  File "/Users/Administrator/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/1.7.0/iphone/builder.py", line 517, in main
    link_version = check_iphone_sdk(iphone_version)
  File "/Users/Administrator/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/1.7.0/iphone/builder.py", line 48, in check_iphone_sdk
    output = run.run(["xcodebuild","-showsdks"],True,False)
  File "/Users/Administrator/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/1.7.0/iphone/run.py", line 7, in run
    proc = subprocess.Popen(args, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 672, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1202, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
fields.summary: Cannot build after downloading latest SDK
fields.environment: OSX 10.7 Lion. Studio 1.0. SDK 1.7.0 (also 1.6.3 and 1.6.2) Indie account IOS SDK 4.3.

comments.body: As an FYI we don't support Lion.
Where is the link to your Q&A post? Closing invalid.

btw, for an explanation of why this has been closed, please see [Submitting Bug Reports|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-SubmittingBugReports]. Thank you.

This sucks big time, closing real bugs as invalid without reason. BTW, the linked page contain no information regarding why this bug could be closed. Thats a good example on why it's too risky to add external dependencies to your code.
